review: This little dongle just made my life so much easier! Previously, we could only get Netflix through our wireless DVD player and we only had that on one TV in the house. Also, when streaming through the DVD player, it would take FOREVER to load and would constantly bump us out while we were watching. We have 8 people (5 kids) living in our house and we have ordered 3 Chromecasts for the various TVs. We don't need to search for a remote because everyone either has a Kindle, smartphone, Nabi, or iPad. Last night, I even pulled up a video on YouTube to show someone something effortlessly. I love that we weren't hunched over an iPad to watch it. Installation of Chromecast is super-simple and since I have subscriptions to HuluPlus, Netflix, and Amazon Prime, I am planning to cancel my cable and get a digital antenna. We can watch everything besides the local news with these apps through Chromecast. This will save me approximately $1,400 per year.

review: Easy to install, and I was watching Hulu plus in minutes! Unlike the photo shows you, though, it does have to be plugged in, but that wasn't a deal breaker for me. Another thing: while it's still in the beta process, for you to stream any videos you have in your computer library, they must be mp4 video or mpeg4 videos. Annoying! Hopefully they will fix it soon, because for everything else, this little guy is a game changer
